verses.verse: And the LORD<WH3068> spake<WH1696> unto Moses<WH4872> and Aaron<WH175>, saying<WH559>,

When a man<WH120> shall have in the skin<WH5785> of his flesh<WH1320> a rising<WH7613>, a scab<WH5597>, or bright spot<WH934>, and it be in the skin<WH5785> of his flesh<WH1320> like the plague<WH5061> of leprosy<WH6883>; then he shall be brought<WH935> unto Aaron<WH175> the priest<WH3548>, or unto one<WH259> of his sons<WH1121> the priests<WH3548>:

And the priest<WH3548> shall look<WH7200> on the plague<WH5061> in the skin<WH5785> of the flesh<WH1320>: and when the hair<WH8181> in the plague<WH5061> is turned<WH2015> white<WH3836>, and the plague<WH5061> in sight<WH4758> be deeper<WH6013> than the skin<WH5785> of his flesh<WH1320>, it is a plague<WH5061> of leprosy<WH6883>: and the priest<WH3548> shall look<WH7200> on him, and pronounce him unclean<WH2930>.

If the bright spot<WH934> be white<WH3836> in the skin<WH5785> of his flesh<WH1320>, and in sight<WH4758> be not deeper<WH6013> than the skin<WH5785>, and the hair<WH8181> thereof be not turned<WH2015> white<WH3836>; then the priest<WH3548> shall shut<WH5462> up him that hath the plague<WH5061> seven<WH7651> days<WH3117>:

And the priest<WH3548> shall look<WH7200> on him the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117>: and, behold, if the plague<WH5061> in his sight<WH5869> be at a stay<WH5975>, and the plague<WH5061> spread<WH6581> not in the skin<WH5785>; then the priest<WH3548> shall shut<WH5462> him up seven<WH7651> days<WH3117> more<WH8145>:

And the priest<WH3548> shall look<WH7200> on him again<WH8145> the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117>: and, behold, if the plague<WH5061> be somewhat dark<WH3544>, and the plague<WH5061> spread<WH6581> not in the skin<WH5785>, the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him clean<WH2891>: it is but a scab<WH4556>: and he shall wash<WH3526> his clothes<WH899>, and be clean<WH2891>.

But if the scab<WH4556> spread much<WH6581> abroad<WH6581> in the skin<WH5785>, after<WH310> that he hath been seen<WH7200> of the priest<WH3548> for his cleansing<WH2893>, he shall be seen<WH7200> of the priest<WH3548> again<WH8145>:
And if the priest<WH3548> see<WH7200> that, behold, the scab<WH4556> spreadeth<WH6581> in the skin<WH5785>, then the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him unclean<WH2930>: it is a leprosy<WH6883>.
¶ When the plague<WH5061> of leprosy<WH6883> is in a man<WH120>, then he shall be brought<WH935> unto the priest<WH3548>;

And the priest<WH3548> shall see<WH7200> him: and, behold, if the rising<WH7613> be white<WH3836> in the skin<WH5785>, and it have turned<WH2015> the hair<WH8181> white<WH3836>, and there be quick<WH4241> raw<WH2416> flesh<WH1320> in the rising<WH7613>;

It is an old<WH3462> leprosy<WH6883> in the skin<WH5785> of his flesh<WH1320>, and the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him unclean<WH2930>, and shall not shut<WH5462> him up: for he is unclean<WH2931>.

And if a leprosy<WH6883> break out<WH6524> abroad<WH6524> in the skin<WH5785>, and the leprosy<WH6883> cover<WH3680> all the skin<WH5785> of him that hath the plague<WH5061> from his head<WH7218> even to his foot<WH7272>, wheresoever the priest<WH3548> looketh<WH4758><WH5869>;

Then the priest<WH3548> shall consider<WH7200>: and, behold, if the leprosy<WH6883> have covered<WH3680> all his flesh<WH1320>, he shall pronounce him clean<WH2891> that hath the plague<WH5061>: it is all turned<WH2015> white<WH3836>: he is clean<WH2889>.
But when<WH3117> raw<WH2416> flesh<WH1320> appeareth<WH7200> in him, he shall be unclean<WH2930>.
And the priest<WH3548> shall see<WH7200> the raw<WH2416> flesh<WH1320>, and pronounce him to be unclean<WH2930>: for the raw<WH2416> flesh<WH1320> is unclean<WH2931>: it is a leprosy<WH6883>.
Or if the raw<WH2416> flesh<WH1320> turn again<WH7725>, and be changed<WH2015> unto white<WH3836>, he shall come<WH935> unto the priest<WH3548>;

And the priest<WH3548> shall see<WH7200> him: and, behold, if the plague<WH5061> be turned<WH2015> into white<WH3836>; then the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him clean<WH2891> that hath the plague<WH5061>: he is clean<WH2889>.
¶ The flesh<WH1320> also, in which<WH3588>, even in the skin<WH5785> thereof, was a boil<WH7822>, and is healed<WH7495>,

And in the place<WH4725> of the boil<WH7822> there be a white<WH3836> rising<WH7613>, or a bright spot<WH934>, white<WH3836>, and somewhat reddish<WH125>, and it be shewed<WH7200> to the priest<WH3548>;

And if, when the priest<WH3548> seeth<WH7200> it, behold, it be in sight<WH4758> lower<WH8217> than the skin<WH5785>, and the hair<WH8181> thereof be turned<WH2015> white<WH3836>; the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him unclean<WH2930>: it is a plague<WH5061> of leprosy<WH6883> broken<WH6524> out of the boil<WH7822>.

But if the priest<WH3548> look<WH7200> on it, and, behold, there be no white<WH3836> hairs<WH8181> therein, and if it be not lower<WH8217> than the skin<WH5785>, but be somewhat dark<WH3544>; then the priest<WH3548> shall shut<WH5462> him up seven<WH7651> days<WH3117>:
And if it spread much<WH6581> abroad<WH6581> in the skin<WH5785>, then the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him unclean<WH2930>: it is a plague<WH5061>.
But if the bright spot<WH934> stay<WH5975> in his place, and spread<WH6581> not, it is a burning<WH6867> boil<WH7822>; and the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him clean<WH2891>.

¶ Or if there be any flesh<WH1320>, in the skin<WH5785> whereof there is a hot<WH784> burning<WH4348>, and the quick<WH4241> flesh that burneth<WH4348> have a white<WH3836> bright spot<WH934>, somewhat reddish<WH125>, or white<WH3836>;

Then the priest<WH3548> shall look<WH7200> upon it: and, behold, if the hair<WH8181> in the bright spot<WH934> be turned<WH2015> white<WH3836>, and it be in sight<WH4758> deeper<WH6013> than the skin<WH5785>; it is a leprosy<WH6883> broken<WH6524> out of the burning<WH4348>: wherefore the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him unclean<WH2930>: it is the plague<WH5061> of leprosy<WH6883>.

But if the priest<WH3548> look<WH7200> on it, and, behold, there be no white<WH3836> hair<WH8181> in the bright spot<WH934>, and it be no lower<WH8217> than the other skin<WH5785>, but be somewhat dark<WH3544>; then the priest<WH3548> shall shut<WH5462> him up seven<WH7651> days<WH3117>:

And the priest<WH3548> shall look<WH7200> upon him the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117>: and if it be spread much<WH6581> abroad<WH6581> in the skin<WH5785>, then the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him unclean<WH2930>: it is the plague<WH5061> of leprosy<WH6883>.

And if the bright<WH934> spot<WH934> stay<WH5975> in his place, and spread<WH6581> not in the skin<WH5785>, but it be somewhat dark<WH3544>; it is a rising<WH7613> of the burning<WH4348>, and the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him clean<WH2891>: for it is an inflammation<WH6867> of the burning<WH4348>.
¶ If a man<WH376> or woman<WH802> have a plague<WH5061> upon the head<WH7218> or the beard<WH2206>;

Then the priest<WH3548> shall see<WH7200> the plague<WH5061>: and, behold, if it be in sight<WH4758> deeper<WH6013> than the skin<WH5785>; and there be in it a yellow<WH6669> thin<WH1851> hair<WH8181>; then the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him unclean<WH2930>: it is a dry scall<WH5424>, even a leprosy<WH6883> upon the head<WH7218> or beard<WH2206>.

And if the priest<WH3548> look<WH7200> on the plague<WH5061> of the scall<WH5424>, and, behold, it be not in sight<WH4758> deeper<WH6013> than the skin<WH5785>, and that there is no black<WH7838> hair<WH8181> in it; then the priest<WH3548> shall shut<WH5462> up him that hath the plague<WH5061> of the scall<WH5424> seven<WH7651> days<WH3117>:

And in the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117> the priest<WH3548> shall look<WH7200> on the plague<WH5061>: and, behold, if the scall<WH5424> spread<WH6581> not, and there be in it no yellow<WH6669> hair<WH8181>, and the scall<WH5424> be not in sight<WH4758> deeper<WH6013> than the skin<WH5785>;
He shall be shaven<WH1548>, but the scall<WH5424> shall he not shave<WH1548>; and the priest<WH3548> shall shut<WH5462> up him that hath the scall<WH5424> seven<WH7651> days<WH3117> more<WH8145>:

And in the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117> the priest<WH3548> shall look<WH7200> on the scall<WH5424>: and, behold, if the scall<WH5424> be not spread<WH6581> in the skin<WH5785>, nor be in sight<WH4758> deeper<WH6013> than the skin<WH5785>; then the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him clean<WH2891>: and he shall wash<WH3526> his clothes<WH899>, and be clean<WH2891>.
But if the scall<WH5424> spread<WH6581> much<WH6581> in the skin<WH5785> after<WH310> his cleansing<WH2893>;

Then the priest<WH3548> shall look<WH7200> on him: and, behold, if the scall<WH5424> be spread<WH6581> in the skin<WH5785>, the priest<WH3548> shall not seek<WH1239> for yellow<WH6669> hair<WH8181>; he is unclean<WH2931>.

But if the scall<WH5424> be in his sight<WH5869> at a stay<WH5975>, and that there is black<WH7838> hair<WH8181> grown<WH6779> up therein; the scall<WH5424> is healed<WH7495>, he is clean<WH2889>: and the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him clean<WH2891>.
¶ If a man<WH376> also or a woman<WH802> have in the skin<WH5785> of their flesh<WH1320> bright spots<WH934>, even white<WH3836> bright spots<WH934>;

Then the priest<WH3548> shall look<WH7200>: and, behold, if the bright spots<WH934> in the skin<WH5785> of their flesh<WH1320> be darkish<WH3544> white<WH3836>; it is a freckled spot<WH933> that groweth<WH6524> in the skin<WH5785>; he is clean<WH2889>.
And the man<WH376><WH3588> whose hair is fallen<WH4803> off his head<WH7218>, he is bald<WH7142>; yet is he clean<WH2889>.
And he that hath his hair fallen<WH4803> off from the part<WH6285> of his head<WH7218> toward his face<WH6440>, he is forehead bald<WH1371>: yet is he clean<WH2889>.

And if there be in the bald head<WH7146>, or bald forehead<WH1372>, a white<WH3836> reddish<WH125> sore<WH5061>; it is a leprosy<WH6883> sprung<WH6524> up in his bald head<WH7146>, or his bald forehead<WH1372>.

Then the priest<WH3548> shall look<WH7200> upon it: and, behold, if the rising<WH7613> of the sore<WH5061> be white<WH3836> reddish<WH125> in his bald head<WH7146>, or in his bald forehead<WH1372>, as the leprosy<WH6883> appeareth<WH4758> in the skin<WH5785> of the flesh<WH1320>;
He is a leprous<WH6879> man<WH376>, he is unclean<WH2931>: the priest<WH3548> shall pronounce him utterly<WH2930> unclean<WH2930>; his plague<WH5061> is in his head<WH7218>.

And the leper<WH6879> in whom the plague<WH5061> is, his clothes<WH899> shall be rent<WH6533>, and his head<WH7218> bare<WH6544>, and he shall put a covering<WH5844> upon his upper lip<WH8222>, and shall cry<WH7121>, Unclean<WH2931>, unclean<WH2931>.

All the days<WH3117> wherein the plague<WH5061> shall be in him he shall be defiled<WH2930>; he is unclean<WH2931>: he shall dwell<WH3427> alone<WH910>; without<WH2351> the camp<WH4264> shall his habitation<WH4186> be.
¶ The garment<WH899> also that the plague<WH5061> of leprosy<WH6883> is in, whether it be a woollen<WH6785> garment<WH899>, or a linen<WH6593> garment<WH899>;
Whether it be in the warp<WH8359>, or woof<WH6154>; of linen<WH6593>, or of woollen<WH6785>; whether in a skin<WH5785>, or in any thing made<WH4399> of skin<WH5785>;

And if the plague<WH5061> be greenish<WH3422> or reddish<WH125> in the garment<WH899>, or in the skin<WH5785>, either<WH176> in the warp<WH8359>, or in the woof<WH6154>, or in any thing<WH3627> of skin<WH5785>; it is a plague<WH5061> of leprosy<WH6883>, and shall be shewed<WH7200> unto the priest<WH3548>:
And the priest<WH3548> shall look<WH7200> upon the plague<WH5061>, and shut<WH5462> up it that hath the plague<WH5061> seven<WH7651> days<WH3117>:

And he shall look<WH7200> on the plague<WH5061> on the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117>: if the plague<WH5061> be spread<WH6581> in the garment<WH899>, either in the warp<WH8359>, or in the woof<WH6154>, or in a skin<WH5785>, or in any work<WH4399> that is made<WH6213> of skin<WH5785>; the plague<WH5061> is a fretting<WH3992> leprosy<WH6883>; it is unclean<WH2931>.

He shall therefore burn<WH8313> that garment<WH899>, whether warp<WH8359> or woof<WH6154>, in woollen<WH6785> or in linen<WH6593>, or any thing<WH3627> of skin<WH5785>, wherein the plague<WH5061> is: for it is a fretting<WH3992> leprosy<WH6883>; it shall be burnt<WH8313> in the fire<WH784>.

And if the priest<WH3548> shall look<WH7200>, and, behold, the plague<WH5061> be not spread<WH6581> in the garment<WH899>, either<WH176> in the warp<WH8359>, or<WH176> in the woof<WH6154>, or<WH176> in any thing<WH3627> of skin<WH5785>;
Then the priest<WH3548> shall command<WH6680> that they wash<WH3526> the thing wherein the plague<WH5061> is, and he shall shut<WH5462> it up seven<WH7651> days<WH3117> more<WH8145>:

And the priest<WH3548> shall look<WH7200> on the plague<WH5061>, after<WH310> that it is washed<WH3526>: and, behold, if the plague<WH5061> have not changed<WH2015> his colour<WH5869>, and the plague<WH5061> be not spread<WH6581>; it is unclean<WH2931>; thou shalt burn<WH8313> it in the fire<WH784>; it is fret<WH6356> inward, whether it be bare within<WH7146> or without<WH1372>.

And if the priest<WH3548> look<WH7200>, and, behold, the plague<WH5061> be somewhat dark<WH3544> after<WH310> the washing<WH3526> of it; then he shall rend<WH7167> it out of the garment<WH899>, or out of the skin<WH5785>, or out of the warp<WH8359>, or out of the woof<WH6154>:

And if it appear<WH7200> still<WH5750> in the garment<WH899>, either in the warp<WH8359>, or in the woof<WH6154>, or in any thing<WH3627> of skin<WH5785>; it is a spreading<WH6524> plague: thou shalt burn<WH8313> that wherein the plague<WH5061> is with fire<WH784>.

And the garment<WH899>, either warp<WH8359>, or woof<WH6154>, or whatsoever thing<WH3627> of skin<WH5785> it be, which thou shalt wash<WH3526>, if the plague<WH5061> be departed<WH5493> from them, then it shall be washed<WH3526> the second<WH8145> time, and shall be clean<WH2891>.

This is the law<WH8451> of the plague<WH5061> of leprosy<WH6883> in a garment<WH899> of woollen<WH6785> or linen<WH6593>, either in the warp<WH8359>, or woof<WH6154>, or any thing<WH3627> of skins<WH5785>, to pronounce it clean<WH2891>, or to pronounce it unclean<WH2930>.
